resources.string: Find out in just a few seconds if the person you are checking has a valid EU Covid-19 certificate.
Data is read using just the QR code. No data is stored. You only see the information that is necessary.
Step one: scan the QR code with the CovPassCheck app

Use the CovPassCheck app to scan the QR code on an EU Digital COVID Certificate. The QR codes on the paper version contain the same information as the QR codes in the electronic version in the CovPass app and other apps in which EU Digital COVID Certificates are saved. Both certificate versions are therefore equivalent to each other.
Step two: check the person’s identity against an ID document

As a checker, the CovPassCheck app only shows you if the Digital COVID Certificate is valid and the name and date of birth of the certificate holder. Check this information against an ID document (e.g. a national ID card or passport). An active internet connection is not required when checking.
It is only lawful to check other people’s QR codes and extract data from Digital COVID Certificates in legally specified situations.
Saving, forwarding or using this data for other purposes is unlawful.

Using Digital COVID Certificates is voluntary. Nobody can be forced to use them. There are other methods for showing evidence of full vaccination, a negative test result or recovery from a Covid-19 infection.
You can find detailed information about data processing in the privacy policy:
Switch off airplane mode or use WLAN for data access
Would you like to update the CovPassCheck app now?
The view \"New features\" has been opened
The view \"When do you use the CovPassCheck app?\" has been opened.
The view \"When do you use the CovPassCheck app?\" has been closed.
When do you use the CovPassCheck app?
Illustration of two people in a checking situation. One person is scanning the certificate of another person. The EU flag is depicted above it.
I check at entries into Germany
For example at the airport or train station
For example, in stores or in the gastronomy
This information is used to adjust the rules according to which certificates are shown as valid or invalid. You can change the specification at any time in the settings.
Do not show this type of notifications anymore
You can change this option anytime in the settings.
Vaccination status according to Infection Protection Act paragraph 22a
A valid vaccination status is achieved by at least three vaccinations or two vaccinations and one recovery.
Please always scan the most recent certificates first.
Scan a G-Proof according to the 3G rules. Which rule applies depends on the federal state you are in.
Scan the necessary evidence for 2G+ one by one.
The authority function is only available in 3G mode!
No test is needed when a booster vaccination is given
Please check the date and time of your smartphone. \n\n It should be: %s
The view \"Verification result“ has been closed
Keep your CovPassCheck app updated in order to check certificates offline. To do this, connect to the internet from time to time.

To verify scanned certificates, the app requires up-to-date lists of trusted certificate issuers as well as the current Corona rules in Germany.\n\nThese lists are updated automatically on a daily basis. You can also manually update them here at any time.
To be able to check reliably without an internet connection, the checking rules should have been updated less than 24 hours ago.
Last updated less than 24 hours ago

The CovPassCheck app uses your smartphone’s camera to scan QR codes.\n\nYour camera is only ever accessed while you use the app and only with your permission. You have the option to change this permission in your smartphone’s settings at any time.
The view \"Camera access needed\" has been opened
The CovPassCheck app wants to access your camera.
Allow access to scan QR codes.
Camera has been opened. The QR code will be scanned automatically.
You have already scanned this certificate. Please scan another certificate.
Check the following data against an ID document from the person you are checking.
* Person has recovery or vaccination certificate.

This is a valid certificate, but it will soon be revoked due to fraud investigations.\n\nPlease advise the certificate holder that he or she must present their yellow vaccination certificate and photo ID to a pharmacy by 11/11/2021. The pharmacy will issue a new vaccination certificate free of charge.
The certificate is invalid for one of the following reasons:
The certificate is not an EU Digital COVID Certificate or has not been issued by an authorized body.
Unable to read the QR code. Please update the CovPassCheck App, if the problem is recurring.
The technical expiry date of the certificate has been exceeded. Scan a newly issued certificate.
The certificates provided do not indicate complete vaccination protection. Possible reasons:
For a complete vaccination status, a series of at least three vaccinations or recoveries must be demonstrated, including at least two vaccinations.
Please always scan the most recent certificates first.
For vaccination series with vaccines not approved in Germany, at least one vaccination with an mRNA vaccine must be proven.
Please scan another proof of vaccination
Please scan another proof of vaccination
Multiple vaccination proofs are required to confirm complete vaccination protection.
The certificate just checked is invalid for one of the following reasons:
The certificate does not comply with German regulations that apply to EU Digital COVID Certificates.
The signature is invalid or the QR code cannot be read.
Negative rapid test from %d hour(s) ago
Check the following data against an ID document from the person you are checking.
Negative PCR test from %d hour(s) ago
Check the following data against an ID document from the person you are checking:
The view \"Verification result for 2G+“ has been closed
* Basic immunization, booster vaccination or recovery.
* Basic immunization or booster vaccination expected
The personal details of the two scanned certificates do not match:
If you think this is not an error (e.g. a typo), you can ignore the discrepancy and continue the check.
You have just scanned this certificate. For 2G+, there is usually one test certificate and one vaccination or recovery certificate to check.
Either combine a second vaccination certificate with a recovery certificate or scan a valid test certificate.
To meet the 2G+ requirements with a recovery older than 90 days, you need to scan a basic immunisation as a second proof.
Here you can find all legal information and answers to the most frequent questions asked about the CovPassCheck app.
Contact for questions about the CovPassCheck app
The view \"Open-source licences\" has been closed
The view \"Open-source licences\" has been opened
The app uses the following open-source libraries:
Here you can update the rules according to which certificates are checked. If your smartphone is usually connected to the Internet, this happens automatically.
The view \"Checking rules\" has been opened
The view \"Checking rules\" has been closed
Here you can update the rules based on which you check certificates. If your smartphone is continuously connected to the internet, this will happen automatically.
If you enable this setting, the app will detect certificates blocked by the authorities even if you are not connected to the Internet. This feature consumes more data volume.
If the function is deactivated, the local app data will be deleted from your device. Certificates can then only be checked in online mode.
The view \"Update rule set\" has been opened
The view \"Check situation\" has been opened
The view \"Beep when checking\" has been opened
The view \"Beep when checking\" has been closed

You will also hear a beep when a result is displayed. Only use this function if you can guarantee that bystanders cannot draw any conclusions about the validity status of the person being checked. The identity check by means of an identification document is still mandatory.

You can now disable the update notifications. You can use the toggle to disable or re-enable the updates at any time. If you disable the update screen, you will no longer receive updates about the latest software developments in the app.
An unexpected error has occurred. Please try again later.
An error occurred while connecting to the server. Please check your internet connection.
The current version of the app you are using does not support this data format. Please check if you have installed the latest version of the app available from the app store on your smartphone.

This QR code does not belong to an EU Digital COVID Certificate. In Germany, you can see that a certificate is correct when it has been issued by the Robert Koch Institute.\n\nYou cannot add QR codes from doctor-issued vaccination certificates or the QR codes on some batch labels in yellow vaccination booklets.

This function is intended exclusively for police authorities and enables them to retrieve the revocation identifier of a certificate in the course of investigations. In normal use, this function should remain deactivated. Attempting to revoke a certificate without authorization using this function is punishable by law and can have serious consequences.\n\nIf you suspect that you have a forged certificate or a certificate with incorrect content, please inform the local police authority.
This function is intended exclusively for police authorities. Attempting to revoke a certificate without authorization is punishable by law and can have serious consequences.
Technical details of the certificate have been opened
Settings about the function for authorities were opened
Here you can update the rules according to which certificates are checked. If your smartphone is usually connected to the Internet, this happens automatically.
Now compare the following data with an identification document of the person being checked.
This view will close by itself after 2 min.
New state rules has been opened
New state rules has been opened
An amendment to the Infection Protection Act comes into force in Germany. Therefore, as of today, your CovPassCheck app will also change.
Exemption from a state-specific mask obligation

You can now use this app to check whether a person\'s evidence is sufficient for exemption from a state-specific masking requirement. To do so, simply select your state before checking.\n\A negative rapid or PCR test exempts 24 hours from this mask requirement. In some states, vaccinations and recoveries may also exempt you from this mask requirement.
This function is intended exclusively for police authorities. Attempting to have a certificate revoked without authorization is punishable by law and can have significant consequences.
The scanned certificate does not exempt from the mask requirement. Possible reasons:
Certificate not within the validity period
It may not have been 28 days since the positive test or the last vaccination/recovery was over 90 days ago.
A different type of certificate is required in your federal state for exemption from the masking requirement.
Three doses of vaccine or two doses of vaccine plus one recovery are required to obtain full vaccine protection.
The certificate is not an EU Digital COVID Certificate or has not been issued by an authorized body.
The QR code is not scannable. Please update the CovPassCheck app if this problem occurs frequently.
It may be that your state allows an exemption from the mask requirement if you have two vaccinations plus one recovery. In this case, scan an additional certificate from the person.
The personal data of the two scanned proofs do not match:
If you think the error is a typo, you can ignore this discrepancy and continue the check
The RKI does not currently have any state-specific rules for this federal state. Therefore, only the uniform federal rules on mandatory masks apply.

If the federal state in which you are staying has ordered a mask obligation, a negative rapid or PCR test exempts you from this mask obligation for 24 hours at recreational, cultural and sporting events and in catering establishments. An unsupervised self-test performed is not sufficient. Your state may regulate that complete vaccinations or recoveries (if these occurred no more than three months ago) also exempt you from the mask requirement.\n\nAn exemption from the mask requirement does not apply in long-distance public transport, hospitals, nursing facilities, and doctors\' offices.
Last updated less than 24 hours ago
Choose federal state has been opened
Choose federal state has been closed
The personal data of the two scanned certificates do not match. Please scan another certificate.
The federal state-specific rules from %s (start of validity) apply.
The RKI currently has no state-specific rules for this federal state. The rules of the federal government apply.
On this basis, the vaccination status is displayed.
On the basis of the Infection Protection Act § 22a
On the basis of the Coronavirus Entry Regulations
Vaccination status according to the Coronavirus Entry Regulations
There are currently no restrictions on entering Germany. To check the vaccination status within Germany according to Infection Protection Act § 22a, change the check context in the #settings.::$0#
The view \"Determine check context\" has been opened.
The view \"Determine check context\" has been closed.
How do you use the CovPassCheck app?
Select on which basis the vaccination status is to be determined:
You can change this at any time in the settings.
There are currently no entry rules to Germany. Do you still want to continue the scanning process?
according to the Coronavirus Entry Regulations
Now match the following data with an identity document of the person being checked.
The rules according to which the app checks certificates will no longer be updated and will remain at the status of 30 May 2023.
